intro: Centropogon verbascifolius, commonly known as the woolly bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Centropogon verbascifolius is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in waterlogged conditions.
